cinnamon.engine.system

Class KeyEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • cinnamon.engine.system.Event
      • cinnamon.engine.system.InputEvent
        • cinnamon.engine.system.KeyEvent

  • public final class KeyEvent
extends InputEvent

    KeyEvents represent InputEvents generated by keyboard interaction and are described by the KeyEvent.Key that performed the InputEvent.Action. Unlike MouseEvents, KeyEvents do not support InputEvent.Action.SCROLL_FORWARD or InputEvent.Action.SCROLL_BACKWARD.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  KeyEvent.Key
      Keyboard key constants for describing KeyEvents.

    • Field Detail

      • SUPPORTED_KEYS

        public static final int SUPPORTED_KEYS

        Number of supported keyboard keys.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • KeyEvent

        public KeyEvent(KeyEvent event)

        Constructs a KeyEvent by copying another.

        While the new KeyEvent will have the same KeyEvent.Key and Action, the value returned by Event.getTime() will reflect the time of the newly constructed.

        Parameters:
        event - KeyEvent to copy.

    • Method Detail

      • getKey

        public KeyEvent.Key getKey()

        Gets the KeyEvent.Key describing the KeyEvent.

        Returns:
        a key constant such as KeyEvent.Key.KEY_A.

      • isKey

        public boolean isKey(KeyEvent.Key key)

        Checks whether or not the KeyEvent is described by a specified KeyEvent.Key.

        Parameters:
        key - key constant such as KeyEvent.Key.KEY_H.
        Returns:
        true if the key describes the KeyEvent.

      • update

        public void update(KeyEvent.Key key,
                   InputEvent.Action action)

        Changes the KeyEvent.Key and Action.

        Timestamp is not copied but updated to the time of this method's execution.

        Parameters:
        key - key constant such as KeyEvent.Key.KEY_K.
        action - either Action#PRESS, Action#RELEASE, or Action#REPEAT.
